effect.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

cost.description: Discard 1 Energy card attached to one of your own Pokemon

requirements.description: Must have at least 1 Energy attached to your Pokemon

restrictions: Can remove up to 2 Energy from single opponent Pokemon

tips: Target opponent's main attacker to prevent their most dangerous attacks
Prioritize removing Double Colorless Energy when possible (maximum value)
Use right before opponent would attack with a powered-up Pokemon
Build deck with low-Energy attackers if running multiple SER
Use Item Finder to recur SER for continuous disruption

rulings.ruling: You must discard exactly 1 Energy card from one of your own Pokemon as a cost
You cannot use Super Energy Removal if you have no Pokemon with Energy attached
You choose one of your opponent's Pokemon and remove up to 2 Energy cards from that single Pokemon
You cannot split the removal across multiple opponent Pokemon
You choose which Energy cards to discard from opponent's Pokemon
Removing a Double Colorless Energy counts as removing 2 Energy (maximum efficiency)
The cost is paid first (discard your Energy), then you choose opponent's Pokemon and Energy
If the targeted Pokemon has only 1 Energy, you can only remove 1 Energy
You can choose to remove fewer than 2 Energy if you want (minimum 0, maximum 2)
If opponent has no Energy on their Pokemon, you can still use SER (it just has no effect after the cost)
Special Energy cards like Double Colorless can be removed
